messages.subject: Re: A favor?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/15/1999 10:55:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time, LouisaEm@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/15/1999 10:55:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
LouisaEm@... writes:

<< I'm countering a BAD piece of advice from a rabid
anti-homeschooling person. She is also advocatithat we all get our toddlers
into pre-school so they can learn to be compassionate. Yikes! >>

Doesn't it just shock you to find a truly "in the box", unenlightened person
like this nowadays?????? Wow!

Sam

messages.subject: Re: A favor?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 99-09-15 22:55:24 EDT, you write: I m countering a BAD piece of advice from a rabid anti-homeschooling person. She is also advocatithat we
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 99-09-15 22:55:24 EDT, you write:
I'm countering a BAD piece of advice from a rabid
anti-homeschooling person. She is also advocatithat we all get our toddlers
into pre-school so they can learn to be compassionate. Yikes!

Kris
>>
Sounds like she needs to spend more time at the local preschool-- I worked in
that racket for years, and the term "compasionate" would never be used to
describe taht environment! LOL Good luck with your fight!

Rachael

messages.subject: A favor?
messages.msgSnippet: I have looked through the archives and cannot find the article on false dependency.  It was the one about how children forced into early detachment form
messages.messageBody:
I have looked through the archives and cannot find the article on false
dependency. It was the one about how children forced into early detachment
form dependency on peers. I'm countering a BAD piece of advice from a rabid
anti-homeschooling person. She is also advocatithat we all get our toddlers
into pre-school so they can learn to be compassionate. Yikes!

Kris
